intro: Macairea stylosa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer.
